thread.title: Angola: Water to Increase to 1.4 Million Cubic Meters in Luanda By 2017
thread.title_full: Angola: Water to Increase to 1.4 Million Cubic Meters in Luanda By 2017

title: Angola: Water to Increase to 1.4 Million Cubic Meters in Luanda By 2017
text:
Nigeria/Cameroon: Cameroon, Nigeria Walk Tightrope After Stalemates 
Luanda — Water Supply Company (EPAL-EP) has announced an increase to 750,000 meters cubic of water by December this year and the product may reach to 1.4 million cubic meters by 2017 in Luanda. 
The Company CEO, Lionidio de Ceita, announced this Friday in Luanda at the end of his visit to the illegal water sales sites in Talatona region. 
The official also announced an increase to 900,000 cubic meters of water by 2016. 
According to him, with the operation of central water treatment in Bita and Kilomga the water is expected to reach about 1.400 million cubic meters in 2017. Angola
